New Records: De'Aaron Fox's combined scoring output of 109 points over two consecutive nights is the second-best in the last 50 years, only one point less than Kobe Bryant's record.
Key Match Events: De'Aaron Fox scored 49 points in the Sacramento Kings' 121-117 win over the Utah Jazz.
Fox shot 16-of-30 from the field and got to the free-throw line 19 times, nearly achieving a double-double with nine assists.
Post-Match Reflections: De'Aaron Fox tweeted a mock apology for falling one point short of matching Kobe Bryant's record.
Fox's teammates DeMar DeRozan, Trey Lyles, and Malik Monk teased him for missing free throws that could have helped him break the record.
